Description:
The University of Vienna was established by its founder Duke Rudolf IV on 12th March 1365, on the model of theUniversities of Bologna and Paris. It is the oldest university in the present-day German linguistic and culturalterritory. 
The eight faculties of the University of Vienna offer a total of 130 courses of study currently attended by about 90,000 students from 130 countries. It is the largest university of Austria with a teaching staff of more than 4,000 and approximately 3,000 students graduating each year.

University: Vienna University of Economics and Business
Description: The WU is over 100 years old. Its predecessor, the Imperial Export Academy, was established on October 1,1898, with the aim of imparting knowledge to businessmen engaged in foreign trade. Immediately following World War I, the Academy became a public World Trade University (Hochschule fur Welthandel), offering a three-year degree program. Following new legislation in 1966, the range of degrees was expanded to the four currently offered. The University was renamed in 1975, this time to Wirtschaftsuniversität Wien (Vienna University of Economics and Business Administration). In 1983, foreign language teaching was expanded at the WU and basic IT studies were made a compulsory part of its degree programs. The 1980s were a period of enormous growth at the WU – between 1981 and 1987 enrollment doubled, from 8,000 to 16,000 and since 1982 the WU has been housed in its large complex in Augasse, where its modern facilities are among the finest in Austria

University: Vienna University of Economics and Business (School of Law‚Äì Themis)
Description: The WU is over 100 years old. Its predecessor, the Imperial Export Academy, was established on October 1,1898, with the aim of imparting knowledge to businessmen engaged in foreign trade. Immediately following World War I, the Academy became a public World Trade University (Hochschule fur Welthandel), offering a three-year degree program. Following new legislation in 1966, the range of degrees was expanded to the four currently offered. The University was renamed in 1975, this time to Wirtschaftsuniversität Wien (Vienna University of Economics and Business Administration).

University: Solvay Brussels School - Economics and Management
Description: Solvay Brussels School – Economics & Management (SBS – EM) is located in the incredibly cosmopolitan Brussels,triple capital of Europe, Belgium and the Flanders region and also host to both NATO and the EU headquarters. Solvay Brussels School is part of Universite Libre du Bruxelles (ULB), which was established in 1834. Known for their strength in Quantitative Finance, they are part of the Q-TEM, a network of like-minded universities strong in this field.

Ghent University is one of the major universities in the Dutch-speaking region of Europe and has been ranked top 100 universities in the world by both Shanghai AWRU and Times Higher Education ranking. It distinguishes itself as a socially committed and pluralistic, public university, with a broad international perspective. Its Faculty of Economics and Business Administration offers high-quality and socially relevant education, research and scientific services to the community.
While its Faculty of Political and Social Sciences is a relatively young faculty that brings together education, research and service within the research areas of Political Sciences, Communication Sciences and Sociology, its Faculty of Law is one of the four founding faculties of the Ghent University and is highly ranked in QS World Subject Ranking.
The university is located in Ghent, a city located in the Flemish region of Belgium and also the capital and largest city of the East Flanders province.

KU Leuven is one of the oldest and most influential Catholic universities in the world. Since its foundation in 1425 it has been a center of academic excellence. KU Leuven is Belgium’s largest university with a student population of about 27,000.The University is located in Leuven, a small but pleasant town 25 kilometers from Brussels, the capital of Belgium and of the European Union.

Founded in 1425, the Catholic University of Louvain is one of the oldest universities in Europe. It was split in 1971 into two separate universities, one Dutch-speaking remaining in Leuven (K.U. Leuven), one French-speaking, established in Louvain-la-Neuve and Brussels. Among its former researchers and teachers, there are Erasmus, Mercator, Vesalius, Vives and Lemaitre.
Today, centers such as the Center for Operation Research and Econometrics (CORE), the Ludwig Institute and the ICP contribute to its international scope. UCL has 130,000 graduates throughout the world.

University: Zagreb School of Economics and Management
Description:
Founded in 2002, Zagreb School of Economics and Management (ZSEM) provides undergraduate and graduate education in economics, management, finance, marketing, and accounting. ZSEM received its AACSB accreditation in 2013 and is in the process of applying for the EQUIS. It has been voted as the best business school in Croatia for five consecutive years. As a young university with a global outlook, ZSEM prepares its students for the global labour market by offering, among its other Bachelor programmes, a fully English-taught track for its Bachelor in Economics & Management.
Zagreb is its nation’s capital, and the most populous city in Croatia. Zagreb today represents the administrative, economic, cultural, transportation and scientific center of Croatia.

University: Prague University of Economics and Business
Description:
VSE is one of the most renowned European universities in the field of economic education. The Commercial College – Vysoka skola obchodni (VSO) was founded in 1919 as an independent department of the Czech Technical University with specializations: wholesale trade, Banking and the Organization of Industrial Firms.
In 1929, VSO was reorganized. The study course is prolonged to four years, a definite incorporation of VSO into the Czech Technical University. In 1934, VSO gained the right to award the degree of Doctor of Commercial Sciences. The Nazis closed down VSO from 1939 to 1945. In 1949, VSO was the University of Political and Economic Sciences with three faculties Economics, Political and Diplomatic and Social Sciences. In 1953, VSE established five faculties: General Economics, Finance and Credit, Statistics, Production Economics and Commerce. From 1990 – 1991 following the Velvet Revolution VSE experienced a general reorganization. In 1998, VSE in Prague became a full member of CEMS. In 1999, it became a full member of PIM. It changed it’s English name from University of Economics, Prague to Prague University of Economics and Business from 1 October 2020.

University: Aarhus School of Business, University of Aarhus
Description: With our 8000 students and more than 500 employees, Aarhus School of Business and Social Sciences, Aarhus University is among the ten largest EQUIS-accredited business schools in Europe. We are educating the leaders of tomorrow. We have a strong international research and study environment and an extensive range of executive programmes. All our programmes aim to prepare tomorrow's leaders and specialists to think focus on intelligent growth, innovation and sustainability. Through our partnerships with a wide range of Danish companies, we ensure that our programmes and activities are relevant and meet the demands of both Danish and international companies and organizations. The global financial crisis and climate crisis has created a new awareness of the need to find long term solutions that are sustainable - economically, socially and environmentally. With a focus on sustainable growth through innovation, Aarhus School of Business and Social Sciences, Aarhus University wants to contribute to solving these global issues. “Sustainable growth through innovation” represents a mindset for our priorities and acts as a focus of our research as well as a recurring element in our education and communication.

Copenhagen Business School (CBS) is a large business university with 19,000 full- and part time students. CBS teaches the traditional courses in Economics, Management and Business Administration but is also well known for the cross-disciplinary research and teaching, and students can combine business with for example philosophy, political science, psychology or communication. CBS is internationally accredited by AACSB, EQUIS and AMBA, the “triple-crown” accreditation. The CBS campus is an urban campus located in Frederiksberg, an integrated part of Copenhagen. Our buildings are modern and we have state-of the-art facilities. Our campus is connected to the airport and downtown Copenhagen with three on-campus Metro stops.

Copenhagen Business School (CBS) is a large business university with 19,000 full- and part time students. CBS teaches the traditional courses in Economics, Management and Business Administration but is also well known for the cross-disciplinary research and teaching, and students can combine business with for example philosophy, political science, psychology or communication. CBS is internationally accredited by AACSB, EQUIS and AMBA, the “triple-crown” accreditation. The CBS campus is an urban campus located in Frederiksberg, an integrated part of Copenhagen. Our buildings are modern and we have state-of the-art facilities. Our campus is connected to the airport and downtown Copenhagen with three on-campus Metro stops.

Our buildings are modern and we have state-of the-art facilities. Our campus is connected to the airport and downtown Copenhagen with three on-campus Metro stops.

Established in 1911, the Aalto University School of Business is the largest and leading business university in Finland, offering the most comprehensive range of degrees in business administration. Aalto University was the first university among the Nordic countries to receive the 'triple crown' accreditation by all three organizations - AACSB, AMBA, EQUIS - that certify business schools. It is also a proud member of the Community of European Management Schools (CEMS) and Programme for International Management (PIM), and participates in the European Erasmus Programme and the NOREK network, which is a part of the Nordic Nordplus Programme

HANKEN's origins date back to 1909, when it was founded by members of the local business community 'as the most advanced institution in Finland with instruction in the Swedish language'. Today, the School is one of Finland's three business schools of university standing. The right to award doctoral degrees was acquired in 1944. The School operates in Helsinki, where a substantial portion of Finland's business is located, and in Ostrobotnia on the west coast, where small and medium sized business predominates - and where many of Finland's Swedish-speakers live. The School also enjoys both high national and international accreditations and has close ties with Finnish hightech and other world-class industry while conducting extensive research operations. The name 'HANKEN' is a nickname for the Swedish name of the school 'Svenska handelshögskolan'. Hanken has been a state-funded institution since 1975 and along with nineteen other Finnish universities is under the supervision of the Ministry of education. Student population: 2,400; Faculty: 135.

Founded in 1819, ESCP Europe is the oldest business school in the world. From very early on, their alumni have carried the School’s values of excellence, humanism and an open exchange of ideas far beyond the borders of France. ESCP Europe offers a large scale of graduate programmes (Masters and Specialised Masters) and executive programs (Executive MBA, custom and open enrolment programs) on 5 European campuses with a network of 60 international partners. Symbolising our five campuses (Paris, London, Berlin, Madrid and Turin) as well as our European ambition, it has been integrated into their revamped website. Please visit us at www.escpeurope.eu. Staying true to humanist principles and anticipating the new course of the world is the European creed and ESCP Europe’s ambition. Our new name and logo translate our history, our values and our future.

Our new name and logo translate our history, our values and our future.

Throughout its 125 years of history, HEC School of Management has continually attracted a special kind of individual highly capable and talented, innovative, entrepreneurial, ambitious and open minded. HEC‘s aim is to train the world leaders of tomorrow. Located in the heart of the thriving, diverse Paris business community, the school has earned international acclaim for its superior programs, groundbreaking research, and outstanding student body. Among the top business schools in Europe, HEC ranks first in France holding the Triple Crown Accreditation from: The Association of MBAs, EQUIS and The American Accreditation AACSB.

Sciences Po is a public research and higher education institution in Paris, France, which specializes in social sciences, politics and international affairs. Established in 1872, Sciences Po has traditionally educated France's political and diplomatic elite, and it is widely considered to be one of the world's most reputable and prestigious schools of the social sciences. Sciences Po maintains faculties in political science as well as economics, history, sociology, law, finance, business, communication, social and urban policy, management and journalism.

The University of Paris-Dauphine was founded in 1968, to promote teaching and research about private and public organizations. The University of Paris-Dauphine is a multidisciplinary institution. It is constantly advancing in a wide range of fields such as Management, Economics, Data Processing and Computer Sciences, computer Sciences for Management, Applied Mathematics and Law.

Sciences Po is a public research and higher education institution in Paris, France, which specializes in social sciences, politics and international affairs. Established in 1872, Sciences Po has traditionally educated France's political and diplomatic elite, and it is widely considered to be one of the world's most reputable and prestigious schools of the social sciences. Sciences Po maintains faculties in political science as well as economics, history, sociology, law, finance, business, communication, social and urban policy, management and journalism.

Established in 1928, the NEOMA Business School – Reims Campus (previously known as Reims Management School) is a French Business school with a strong international dimension and promotes cultural diversity. On 24 April 2013, Rouen Business School and Reims Management School announced the merger of the two Schools into a single entity. The new school will be jointly headed by its Chairman, Yves Bénard (the former Chairman of Reims Management School) and its Dean, Frank Bostyn. NEOMA Business School has a dual purpose: to be ranked among the best European schools, and to be recognized as a key corporate partner. In order to serve the interests of all its stakeholders as well as possible, the new entity will leverage the skills and strengths that have made excellence the hallmark of both founding Schools.

Founded in 1903 by the Toulouse Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the school's initial vocation was to respond to the needs of the local business community for able business administrators. Originally housed in a 15th century monastery located in the old town centre, the School's present premises include a downtown campus and an ultra-modern 'electronic' campus located on the perimeter of the city. The downtown campus, a blend of aesthetic architectural harmony and functional excellence, is located at the heart of the business complex near the centre of metropolitan Toulouse. Among the top business schools in France and in Europe, ESC Toulouse holds the Triple Crown Accreditation: AMBA (The Association of MBAs); the European accreditation EQUIS from EFMD; the American Accreditation AACSB.

Freie Universität Berlin was founded by students and scholars on December 4, 1948, with the support of the American Allies and Berlin politicians as a response to the persecution of students critical of the system at Universität Unter den Linden in the Soviet sector of the divided city of Berlin. These students and scholars wanted to study and carry out research at Freie Universität, free of political influence. Thanks to generous donations from the United States, Freie Universität was able to construct several new central building complexes including the Benjamin Franklin university clinic complex and the Henry Ford Building, the central lecture building. Based on its founding tradition, Freie Universität’s seal to this day bears the Latin terms for Truth, Justice, and Liberty. The foundation of Freie Universität Berlin was facilitated through international support, and international impulses have shaped its research ever since. Currently, Freie Universität has over 130 partnerships with scholarly institutions worldwide. The university is a drawing card for international researchers. Freie Universität and Ludwig-MaximiliansUniversität München are the two most often selected locations for visiting scholars through the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation. About 600 foreign scholars contribute to the diversity in research and teaching. Of its approximately 31,000 students in over 100 subject areas, 16 percent come from abroad.

University: Freie Universität Berlin Law School - Themis

The university was founded in Berlin in 1810, and the foundation concept of Wilhelm von Humboldt gave it the title 'Mother of all modern universities'. From the outset, the university in Berlin had the four classical faculties of Law, Medicine, Philosophy and Theology. Its first academic term began with 256 students and 52 teaching staff. Professors such as Georg Friedrich Wilhelm Hegel (Philosophy), Karl Friedrich von Savigny (Law), August Boeckh (Classical Philology), Christoph Wilhelm Hufeland (Medicine) and Albrecht Daniel Thaer (Agriculture), shaped the profile of the individual faculties in accordance with Humboldt's concept. The University currently maintains formal contacts to nearly 100 academic institutions on all continents, and holds more than 400 formal contracts within the Socrates Program. Students from over 100 different foreign countries are presently enrolled at Humboldt-Universität.

Goethe-University Frankfurt am Main is a lively, urban, and cosmopolitan university that provides an excellent atmosphere in which to research, study, think and create. The university was founded in 1914 through private funding. Thus, the university owes its establishment to the link – which is characteristic for the city of Frankfurt – between dynamic research, the legacy of the Enlightenment, and the conscious commitment of the citizens of Frankfurt to the fundamentals of international trade and industry. With 35,000 enrolled students, 600 Professors, as well as academic and non-academic staff on four campuses, Frankfurt University ranks among the major universities in Germany.

Top-level research, excellence in teaching and studies, internationality and interdisciplinary collaboration have stood for the University of Konstanz since its foundation as a Reform University in 1966. The University of Konstanz is a modern campus university with a clearly-defined, excellent profile. We offer study programmes in the fields of mathematics and natural science; humanities; politics; law and economics. With 1,300 students from over 90 countries worldwide, we’re proud to call the University of Konstanz a truly international community. The city of Konstanz and Lake Constance offer a wide range of recreational activities.

The University of Mannheim emerged from the state college of economics which was originally the college of commerce. In 1967, following the addition of broader subjects the college was extended to a university. The University of Mannheim has an impressive profile to offer its students and visitors. At the heart of the university are the faculties of Business and Social Sciences. In these two fields, the University of Mannheim ranks among the best universities in Germany. The other existing faculties offered – Law, Humanities, Mathematics and Computer Science – not only reflect a high level themselves but are also interdisciplinary with the Business & Social Sciences. On an international level, Mannheim holds the 1st AACSB (The International Association for Management Education) as an accredited School of Business Administration.

People come to LMU Munich seeking its unique academic diversity. Its 18 faculties give around 700 professors and 3,000 academic staff room to research and teach. They offer a wide and well-rounded range of learning opportunities that cover all areas, whether humanities and culture studies, law, economics and sociology, or medicine and the sciences. LMU Munich takes the education of young people very seriously. When they speak of academic diversity, they also mean a comprehensive education that encompasses social skills alongside a critical awareness of values and history. This includes the Munich legacy of the Weisse Rose, the student-based resistance group that opposed Nazism.

The TUM first saw the light of day in 1868 in the form of the independent “Royal Polytechnic” founded by King Ludwig II. As Carl Max von Bauernfeind, its first rector said in his inauguration address, the establishment was founded to “bring the vitalizing sparks of science to bear on technology”. TUM has now 20,000 students and three campuses in Munich. TUM holds a leading place in many respects: it is ranked foremost among German universities in terms of both total research grant turnover (approx. € 130million in 1999) and the number of guest researchers from all over the world, working at TUM with the support of the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation.

Founded in 1971, EBS is the oldest private Business School with state accredited university status. The programs in Business Administration and Information Systems as well as business law combine sound academic foundations with a powerful international dimension in their commitment to meet the needs of tomorrow’s managers. Leading business companies like DaimlerChrysler, Porsche AG, Deutsche Bank AG, among many others, support EBS. EBS stands among vineyards of the Rhine-Valley and within easy reach of Frankfurt, Europe’s financial capital and Frankfurt International Airport. In geographical terms, EBS is at the centre of Europe.

The University of Tübingen was founded in 1477 by Count (later Duke) Eberhard im Bart. In 1534 Duke Ulrich I of Wuerttemberg brought the Reformation to Tübingen, and two years later established a Protestant Theological Seminary, the Tübingen Stift, as an academic bastion of the new faith in Southern Germany. This theological institution has been of particular importance in establishing the University's reputation, and has had a significant influence on the course of German intellectual history, particularly in the 18th and 19th centuries. More recently, the medical and natural sciences centers moved up to the hills north of the city center. The University of Tübingen consolidated its reputation as one of the outstanding universities in Europe.

University: WHU - Otto Beisheim School of Management
Description: The WHU Koblenz, a private university, was founded in 1984 by the business community for the business community. It is the first school in Germany to offer courses in business administration which focus corporate management. State-accredited, with full university status, it offers an eight-semester programme in business management (Betriebswirtschaftslehre) and a weekend Executive MBA Programme. The WHU Koblenz is located in Vallendar, near the city of Koblenz.

The University of Iceland was founded on 17 June 1911, on the centenary of 19th-century Icelandic statesman Jón Sigurðsson, usually referred to as 'president'. The University of Iceland is a progressive educational and scientific institution, renowned in the global scientific community for its research. It is a state university, situated in the heart of Reykjavík, the capital of Iceland. A modern, diversified, and rapidly developing institution, the University of Iceland offers opportunities for study and research in over 400 programmes spanning most fields of science and scholarship: Social Sciences, Health Sciences, Humanities, Education, Natural Sciences and Engineering.

Founded in 1592, Trinity is at the nexus of tradition and innovation, offering undergraduate and postgraduate programmes across 24 schools and three faculties: arts, humanities, and social sciences; engineering, mathematics and science; and health sciences. Spread across 47 acres in Dublin's city centre, Trinity's 17,000-strong student body comes from all 32 counties of Ireland, and 16% of students come from outside the country.

With over 20,000 students and almost 2500 academic staff, University College Dublin is Ireland’s largest and most influential university. Its 2000 international students also give the university an international atmosphere and reputation. The university dates its origin from the foundation in 1851 of the Catholic University of Ireland. It opened officially in 1854. Some of the more celebrated literary figures associated with the early days of the University are the poets Gerard Manley Hopkins and Austin Clarke, and the world famous novelist James Joyce.

University: University College Dublin Sutherland School of Law
Description: Ranked one of the Top 100 Universities in the World for Law, UCD Sutherland School of Law is the leading centre for legal education and research in Ireland. It is committed to the development and creation of new initiatives, to enriching the educational environment of its student body, to working in partnership with the practising legal profession and to establishing a major, well-regarded and authoritative presence in the international legal community. It also offers visiting students the opportunity to study and immerse themselves in the largest Law School in Ireland. The School has an exceptional academic community where students enjoy direct engagement with experts in the field who are at the cutting edge of teaching and research. UCD Sutherland School of Law is part of the University College Dublin which is a vibrant, modern university with around 24,000 students and is located on a spacious and leafy campus some 5km to the south of Dublin city centre.

LIUC Universita Cattaneo Castellanza is named after Carlo Cattaneo, a 19th century local thinker and economist. It is a state recognized university that has developed rapidly since its establishment in 1991. It was founded on the initiative of the Industrial Association of the Province of Varese (UNIVA) and it was immediately recognized for the close relationship it has with the business world. Today its three Faculties – Economics, Engineering and Law – are open to a limited number of students (about 3,000 in total). All courses are interdisciplinary with cross-faculty teaching in order to provide students with a broad based education and overall understanding of the different business functions.

Università Bocconi is considered one of Europe’s leading educational institutions in Economics, Management, Finance and Law. Our business school was ranked 7th in Europe according to the Financial Times European Business School Rankings 2011, the MSc in International Management is 23rd worldwide according to the Financial Times Masters in Management Rankings 2012 and the full-time MBA was ranked 28th worldwide according to the Financial Times Global MBA Rankings 2011. Bocconi is a member of two important international exchange networks, the Partnership in International Management (PIM) and The Global Alliance in Management Education (CEMS). In addition to these networks Bocconi has bilateral agreements with about 200 top-ranked partner schools worldwide and exchanges more than 1200 students every year.

The University of Milan is a public, multidisciplinary teaching and research institution that offers 8 Faculties, 2 Schools, 136 study courses, 31 Doctoral Programmes and 63 Specialisation Schools. Our 2000 professors represent the highest concentration of scientific expertise in the region and our research is ranked among the best in Italy and Europe.

University: Libera Università Internazionale degli Studi Sociali Guido Carli
Description: LUISS is an independent university. Through its Faculties of Economics, Law and Political Science (and its three Departments of Historical and Socio-political Science, Economics and Business Administration and Law) it offers an educational model that aims to achieve effective integration between the university and production systems. LUISS exercises a constant collaboration, dialogue and exchange with all players participating in the educational process: academics, researchers, young people, businesses and institutions. LUISS has 5,800 students; 750 faculty members; an average of 180 students studying overseas and an increasing number of foreign exchange students on campus.

Vilnius University founded in 1579, is the oldest university in the Baltic States and one of the oldest and most famous establishments of higher education in Eastern and Central Europe. It is also the largest University in Lithuania. Functioning for a long time as the only school of higher learning in Lithuania, it was a preserver of cultural and scientific traditions, and has played a significant part in the cultural life not only of Lithuania, but the neighboring countries as well. During more than four centuries of its existence, the University of Vilnius has seen periods of growth and decline, revival, and closure. The University is a unique witness to the history of the Lithuanian state.

Amsterdam, the capital of the Netherlands, has been a renowned cultural, scientific and commercial centre for many centuries. It was here, in 1880, that VU University Amsterdam first opened its doors to students. VU stands for 'Vrije Universiteit' which means 'Free University'. Here, 'free' refers to freedom from state and church interference Throughout the past century, the University has expanded and now comprises twelve faculties and has teaching facilities for 23,000 students. The University campus and university hospital are situated in the south-western part of Amsterdam, one of the most dynamic and fast-growing business districts in the Netherlands and the financial heart of Amsterdam. With over fifty undergraduate programmes and almost a hundred postgraduate programmes, VU University Amsterdam offers a wide range of high quality academic programmes in a stimulating environment.

The Norwegian School of Economics (NHH) was founded in 1936. The School represents Norway’s largest and most prestigious center of research and education with these subject areas. NHH is a full-scale business school with programs of study ranging from evening classes to doctoral level courses in business administration, finance, economics and management. It has over 2,800 full time students and a total staff of more than 330. The school co-operates closely with the Administrative Research Institute and the Institute of Research in Economics & Business Administration at NHH. Together, NHH and its associated institutes constitute a major academic organizational entity with more than 470 employees. NHH is located in beautiful Bergen, the capital of Western Norway, and gateway to the fjords.

The BI Norwegian Business School was established in Oslo in 1943 as a privately-owned institution – seven years after the Norwegian government founded the country’s first school of higher education in business and economics. The original name of the BI Norwegian Business School was “Bedriftsokonomisk Institutt”, or BI, which are the initials still associated with the school. As a rule, higher public education in Norway is fully financed by the government. As a private, non-profit foundation, however, NSM BI receives little public funding and is largely dependent on tuition, research grants, and co-operative programmes with the business community. The campus is situated at Schous, in the center of Oslo.

The high quality of teaching in the University of Economics in Katowice study programmes, both on bachelor and master level, has been confirmed by accreditation certificates awarded by the Accreditation Committee of the Foundation for the Promotion and Accreditation of Economic Education in Warsaw. The following study programmes have been awarded quality of education certificates: Management and Marketing, Informatics and Econometrics, Economics, Finance and Banking. Moreover, Management and Marketing has been awarded a quality of education certificate by the State Accreditation Committee.

Since its beginnings (1989) the LKAEM has been committed to educating students in a wide range of businessrelated areas. Its pursuit of excellence was recognized and rewarded when in 1997 the prestigious annual list of Poland’s business schools published by the Wprost magazine ranked them as the best among the private institutions of higher education, and second among over 100 Polish business schools. The LKAEM employs outstanding scholars from Poland and from abroad, and is frequently visited by distinguished professors, including Nobel Prize winners as well as distinguished members of the business community & political leaders. LKAEM offers 7 programmes entirely taught in English, out of which 3 are undergraduate level.

Warsaw School of Economics is the oldest and most prestigious economic school in Poland as well as one of the leading universities of economics and management in Central and Eastern Europe. It started its activities on 13th October 1906 under the name of 'August Zieliński’s Private Trade Courses for Men' during the time of the Russian occupation. Since the school was established, it has educated almost 70,000 graduates and awarded over 1,700 PhD degrees in Economics and Management. At present, there are more than 15,000 students and 923 academic teachers.

University: Universidade Católica Portuguesa, CATÓLICA-LISBON - School of Business and Economics
Description: CATÓLICA-LISBON is the only Portuguese Business School among Europe's Top 25 and is one of the less than 1% of business schools worldwide to be accredited by all three management education associations - EQUIS, AMBA and AACSB - and is the first and sole Portuguese Business School ranked in the Financial Times Executive Education Rankings. In 2009, CATÓLICA-LISBON was ranked as 37th best in the world and 17th best in Europe.

The Universidade Nova de Lisboa was founded in 1973 within a framework of expansion and diversification in Portuguese higher education. Following its first 4 years of existence, the initial model was adapted in order to carry out the University’s commitment towards excellence in teaching and research. At present, NOVA consists of 5 Faculties, 3 Institutes and 1 School. It awards undergraduate degrees in around 40 areas and offers 65 Masters, 20 PhDs and 44 Postgraduate degree programmes. It also has 49 research centers financed by the Portuguese Foundation for Science and Technology. Total student population: 14,200 (1,400 in graduate programmes)

University: Lomonosov Moscow State University Business School
Description: Lomonosov Moscow State University Business School (Lomonosov MSU BS) founded in 1989 in Moscow State University is one of the oldest business schools in Russia. Lomonosov MSU BS’s programmes (Bachelor in Business Administration, Master in International Business, MBA and Executive MBA Programs; Doctoral Program) are designed to meet the most refined demands of Russian and foreign students of all levels. Lomonosov MSU BS melts academic traditions of MSU with innovative techniques of teaching business and management. Having strong connections with Russian business world, Lomonosov MSU BS also offers tailor-made corporate programmes. The ambition to be the best is rewarded by our graduates’ recognition – Lomonosov MSU BS is ranked #1 in Russia according to the 2007 and 2008 year surveys held by the leading business magazine 'Secret Firmy' (¹37 (269), 2008; ¹36 (219), 2007).

University: National Research University Higher School of Economics (HSE)
Description: The National Research University Higher School of Economics (HSE) is one of the leading and largest universities in Russia.The university specializes in economics, social sciences, mathematics, computer science, media communications and design. It has more than twenty departments, with its main campus located in Moscow and three additional campuses in St. Petersburg, Nizhniy Novgorod and Perm. The university has established and maintained connections with international research and educational institutions including the London School of Economics, the Erasmus University Rotterdam, DAAD and many others. HSE is recognized as one of the top three universities in Russia, alongside Lomonosov Moscow State University and MGIMO (Moscow State Institute of International Relations).

The Plekhanov is the largest economic institution of higher education in Russia and the former Soviet Union. It was founded in 1907 and, was at that time, the only university at which women were permitted to study. Among the founders was Viashnikov, merchant of the first guild together with members of other distinguished dynasties such as the Abrikosovs, the Smirnovs, and others. It all started with a group of only 50 students. Today there are more than 13,000 students in the Academy. The Plekhanov diploma is certified by UNESCO. This international recognition is underlined by double diploma agreements with universities in the Netherlands, Britain, Denmark and the United States of America.

University: Saint Petersburg State University, Graduate School of Management
Description: The Graduate School of Management, GSOM is one of the 22 schools (faculties) of Saint Petersburg State University. It was founded in 1993 as School of Management later renamed to preserve consistency into Faculty of Management. In 2005, it was chosen to become a part of the National Priority Project in Education aimed at creating two leading business schools in Russia. Saint Petersburg State University, is a Russian federal stateowned higher education institution based in Saint Petersburg. It is the oldest and one of the largest universities in Russia.

ESADE was founded in 1958 by a group of business persons in collaboration with the Society of Jesus (Jesuits). It subsequently became a civil foundation, after the restoration of democracy in Spain. With more than 45 years of experience, ESADE today is one of the most prestigious universities in Europe and offers a wide range of programmes, adapted to the most diverse training needs: university courses, postgraduate courses, different formats of MBA and Doctoral programmes. On 2nd February 2009, the ESADE undergraduate, MSc and PhD Business Programmes had moved to their new Campus Barcelona-Sant Cugat, 15 km from Barcelona on the other side of the Collserola mountain range and Natural Park.

On 2nd February 2009, the ESADE undergraduate, MSc and PhD Business Programmes had moved to their new Campus Barcelona-Sant Cugat, 15 km from Barcelona on the other side of the Collserola mountain range and Natural Park.

In its mission, the Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona defines itself as a public Catalan university with an international outlook. For the university, internationalisation is one of the tools to achieve its objectives in offering quality education, research and knowledge transfer. Our internationalisation strategy is based on three fundamental lines of action: mobility, collaboration and cooperation, and the attraction of talent. Mobility must give our students, lecturers and administration staff the chance to work in prestigious universities mainly through exchange programmes. Collaboration with other universities and institutions must permit students and lecturers to discover and propose new teaching experiences and open new fields of research together with other prestigious universities. Cooperation with developing countries contributes to the construction of a more solidary university committed to social reality. Attraction of talent aims to select the best students, especially at the master's degree and PhD level, and attract the best lecturers from around the world. To foster these objectives we place special importance on strategic alliances with other universities through a variety of consortiums and networks.

Universitat Pompeu Fabra is inspired by the principles of freedom, democracy, justice, equality and independence within the context of a plural society. It is committed to training first-rate professionals and turning out citizens who will uphold the highest social values. UPF is also unwavering in its pursuit of research excellence. It is a city university engaged in the active, dynamic life of the city of Barcelona, and a university that is wide open to the world beyond. Public, city-based, and cosmopolitan: those are the values that identify UPF as an institution working in the service of society. Universitat Pompeu Fabra is named after the man who laid down the standards of the modern Catalan language.

Universidad Carlos III de Madrid is a Spanish public university that, in its 18 years, has attained recognized prestige for their high level of education. Carlos III is the only Spanish University in which ALL of its PhD programmes have received the “Mencion de Calidad” (a hallmark award certifying the high quality of a programme) from the Ministry of Education and Science. The outstanding full-time Carlos III faculty, many of whom hold PhDs from top universities in the U.S. and Europe, reflect the highest percentage of university professors receiving favourable evaluations from the MEC (Ministry of Education and Science). In addition, Carlos III University ranks number one in Spain for research competitiveness according to the COTEC report, with some of its scientific research areas rated among the best in Europe in international rankings.

Pope Leo XIII founded the Seminary of San Antoni de Padua in 1890 in the town of Comillas (province of Santander, Spain) in response to efforts made by the Marquis of Comillas to build an institution for educating candidates to the priesthood. At the time of its foundation, the Seminary was entrusted to the Society of Jesus. In 1904, the Universidad Pontificia was established when Pope Pius X granted “COMILLAS” the power to confer academic degrees in Theology, Philosophy and Canon Law. During the sixties the University was transferred to Madrid. Currently, Comillas has 7,700 undergraduates & 4,300 students in special or post-graduate study. There are over 1,000 foreign students in Comillas & 1,882 full time & part-time teachers. The university has Faculties of Theology, Canon Law, Human & Social Sciences, Law & Business Administration & Economics, the “Escuela Tecnica Superior de Ingeniera, ICAI” as well as the Schools of Nursing & Physiotherapy.

IE University is the No. 1 University in Spain, No. 12 in Europe and No. 34 worldwide in the Global Employability Survey and University Ranking 2013 published by US daily International New York Times. IE University is for students who believe that learning is a way of life and are open to the transforming role of higher education. IE University is marked by its international campus, entrepreneurial spirit, pioneering initiatives, and commitment to educate young professionals and experts for an international vocation, able to make a positive impact on society. IE University creates a specific learning environment based on our values of academic rigor, the integration of different fields of knowledge, both theoretical and practice based; a humanistic education and personalized guidance. IE University holds a leading position in Europe among institutions of higher education for excellence in innovation and learning technologies. In addition, its undergraduate programs are recognized by the most prestigious associations in their respective fields, and highly regarded by employers of leading corporations.

The University of Gothenburg has approximately 50,000 students and 5,000 employees. It is one of the largest universities in Scandinavia. With its eight faculties and approximately sixty departments, the University of Gothenburg is also the most wide-ranging and versatile university in Sweden, offering unique opportunities for cooperation and development. The distinctive characteristic of university education at the University of Gothenburg is the close interaction between teaching and research. Students are kept informed of the latest developments in the field they are studying and researchers gain inspiration from their students’ expectations and needs. At the University of Gothenburg research and teaching are regarded as equally important, and there is ongoing pedagogical development work. In an international perspective too, the University of Gothenburg is comprehensive, with cutting-edge research in a number of dynamic research areas.

At Jönköping University there are four different schools. All schools offer courses in English for international students. All of the academic programmes focus on SME and entrepreneurship in their activities and courses. The education is delivered in English, and you will be integrated in the same courses and share the same accommodation with Swedish students

Lund University was founded in 1666, partly in order to knit the provinces which had been ceded by Denmark in 1658 closer to Sweden. Since then, the University has developed into a modern international centre for research and higher education. At present, more than 34 000 students are enrolled at Lund University and altogether some 6000 people are employed.

KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm is the largest and oldest technical university in Sweden. No less than one-third of Sweden’s technical research and engineering education capacity at university level is provided by KTH. Education and research spans from natural sciences to all branches of engineering and includes Architecture, Industrial Management and Urban Planning.

Stockholm School of Economics is one of Europe’s leading business schools, with a unique business community network. The research is internationally recognized and many researchers are among the leading figures in their respective fields. The school is the only privately funded university in Sweden founded in 1909 on the initiative of Swedish business leaders. SSE has a good reputation and is consistently ranked by the Financial Times as the number 1 business school in the Nordic and Baltic countries.

Stockholm School of Economics is one of Europe’s leading business schools, with a unique business community network. The research is internationally recognized and many researchers are among the leading figures in their respective fields. The school is the only privately funded university in Sweden founded in 1909 on the initiative of Swedish business leaders. SSE has a good reputation and is consistently ranked by the Financial Times as the number 1 business school in the Nordic and Baltic countries.

Uppsala University is a leading research university where education grows out of research. In a great number of disciplines Uppsala University is on the international research front. Their long-term commitment is to maintain and reinforce their prominent position. This takes the form of vigorous investments for global excellence in research and education. New cross-disciplinary programs, the creation of new campuses, and growing groundbreaking research are some of the key tools in this ongoing process of rejuvenation. They also strive to stimulate cooperation between higher education, business, and the surrounding community. Today's research and education build on deeply rooted traditions of learning. Living traditions and rich culture are part of their strength.

Founded in 1559 by Jean Calvin, the University of Geneva (UNIGE) is dedicated to thinking, teaching, dialogue and research. With 16’000 students of more than 140 different nationalities, it is Switzerland’s second largest university. UNIGE offers more than 280 types of degrees and more than 250 Continuing Education programmes covering an extremely wide variety of fields: exact sciences, medicine and humanities. Its domains of excellence in research include life sciences (molecular biology, bio-informatics), physics of elementary particles, and astrophysics. UNIGE is also host and co-host to six National Centres of Competence in Research: Frontiers in Genetics, Materials with Novel Electronic Properties (MaNEP), Chemical Biology, Affective Sciences, Synaptic Bases of Mental Diseases and LIVES-Overcoming vulnerabilities in a life course perspective.

Originally founded as the Académie in 1537, the University of Lausanne (UNIL) is a modern institution that, along with neighboring Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), forms a focal point for higher education and leading research, at not only a local level, but also at a national and international level. With seven faculties (Theology and Religious Studies, Law and Criminal Justice, Arts, Social and Political Sciences, Business and Economics, Geosciences and Environment, Biology and Medicine), the University of Lausanne is a well-rounded university. It is attended by 10’000 students and 2’200 researchers. At the University of Lausanne, student-professor interactions as well as interdisciplinary are encouraged. HEC Lausanne is the affiliated business school of the University of Lausanne.

The University of Lucerne is a young one. Although its roots reach back to 1600, it has only formed part of Switzerland’s twelve universities since 2000. The University of Lucerne is limited to three faculties and distinguished by a slim and clearly identifiable profile. With its faculties of theology, cultural and social sciences and law, it concentrates on three core areas and thus bundles competence in humanities and trains qualified jurists. The convenient size of the University of Lucerne provides students with a great degree of freedom and innovative combination possibilities. Study courses are offered in traditional subjects as well as in overlapping subjects (integrated); moreover, it is possible to combine elements from different faculties. The excellent support of students is a special feature of the University of Lucerne.

The University of St. Gallen for Business Administration, Economics, Law and Social Sciences (HSG) was founded in 1898 as a «business academy» and enrolled its first students in 1899. The HSG, which became a business university in 1911, continues to this day to pursue the goal – set at its foundation – of providing for its students a practice- oriented education. When, in 1963, it moved to new accommodation on the Rosenberg, it had some 1,000 students and 27 professors. At the beginning of 1999, there were about 4,500 students (of whom some 23% were women) and over 70 professors.

University: University of St Gallen (Faculty of Law)

The University of Zurich (UZH) with its 26,000 enrolled students is Switzerland's largest university. Founded in the year 1833, UZH was Europe's first university to be established by a democratic political system; today, UZH is one of the foremost universities in the German-speaking world. Made up of seven faculties covering some 100 different subject areas, the University offers a wide variety of Bachelor's, Master's and PhD programs. In addition, UZH's continuing education programs offer excellent learning opportunities.

University: University of Zurich - Faculty of Law

Made up of seven faculties covering some 100 different subject areas, the University offers a wide variety of Bachelor's, Master's and PhD programs. In addition, UZH's continuing education programs offer excellent learning opportunities.

The University of Amsterdam (UvA) has a strong international orientation. This is reflected in the curricula of the various degree programmes, the University’s research activities and its organisational culture. The globalisation of the labour market is creating growing demand for highly trained staff with international and intercultural competences, and international academic or work experienc The UvA’s international character is also reflected in its organisational culture. The UvA offers various services designed to help students, researchers and lecturers from other countries feel at home in Amsterdam and the Netherlands. The University also uses bilingual communications to help ensure that they feel or continue to feel part of the UvA community. Like its students, UvA lecturers are also expected to have explored the wider world and obtained international competences. The UvA stimulates them to teach for a semester at an international university, take part in international conferences or teach or attend a summer school abroad.

The University of Groningen has a rich academic tradition dating back to 1614. Out of this tradition rose a Nobel prize-winner, the first woman student and the first woman lecturer in the Netherlands, the first Dutch astronaut and the first president of the European Central Bank. Geographically, the university is rooted in the North of the Netherlands, a region very close to its heart. Several members of the Dutch royal family have also studied in Groningen, including Prince Maurits and Prince Bernard, both of whom studied economics at the University of Groningen

Leiden University, founded in 1575, is the oldest university in the Netherlands and enjoys an outstanding international reputation. The University offers a broad range of 46 bachelor's programmes and 73 master's programmes, from its 7 faculties; Archaeology, Campus The Hague, Humanities, Medicine/LUMC, Law, Social and Behavioural Sciences, and Science. Leiden University has some 24,500 students (from 110 different countries) and 5,500 staff (including Leiden University Medical Center), with a key focus on strong international orientation, developing a research-intensive profile and ensuring teaching and research of the highest quality.

Established in 1975, Universiteit Maastricht is the youngest university in The Netherlands. The university’s innovative and progressive learning method is clearly in accordance with this youthful allure. In Maastricht you will work in small groups in which you are confronted with real-life problems derived from a particular field of study. Universiteit Maastricht enjoys a highly international stature; due to the large amount of foreign students at UM, one in five students has a non-Dutch nationality. The university’s international orientation is underlined by the fact that several programmes are fully taught in English.

University: Erasmus University, School of History, Culture and Communication (ESHCC)
Description: The Erasmus School of Economics is a leading academic institution in the world. Our school has a long-standing tradition of high-quality education and research. The best of our graduates have made outstanding contributions to science, government and business. Our education programmes start with the basic principles and end at the forefront of current scientific developments, taught and supervised by active, motivated researchers.

University: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

The best of our graduates have made outstanding contributions to science, government and business. Our education programmes start with the basic principles and end at the forefront of current scientific developments, taught and supervised by active, motivated researchers.

Our education programmes start with the basic principles and end at the forefront of current scientific developments, taught and supervised by active, motivated researchers.

Tilburg University (Katholieke Universiteit Brabant) was funded in 1927 and was originally a School of Economics. It is now a fully accredited, government-financed university and has 11,000 students, 750 international students, from over 50 countries, 460 of which are degree seeking students, 170 full professors. Tilburg University is well known for its high standards in education and scientific research as well as its good support facilities. In nationwide yearly rankings, Tilburg University has taken a top-position for many years now. Its campus, designed with a compact architectural concept in mind, is set in gently undulating, park-like grounds on a forest edge.

The University of Bath was founded by Royal Charter in 1966, and is a public institution, recognized by the British Government for the award of degrees. British Government Statutory Instrument 1997 No.1, the Education (Recognized Bodies) Order 1997 includes the University of Bath in its list of accredited Higher Education Institutions. The University of Bath awarded its own degrees at undergraduate and postgraduate level. The University of Bath is a member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities, of the Universities UK of the United Kingdom and of the Association of European Universities.

University: University of Bath Department of Economics
Description: The University of Bath was founded by Royal Charter in 1966, and is a public institution, recognized by the British Government for the award of degrees. British Government Statutory Instrument 1997 No.1, the Education (Recognized Bodies) Order 1997 includes the University of Bath in its list of accredited Higher Education Institutions. The University of Bath awarded its own degrees at undergraduate and postgraduate level. The University of Bath is a member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities, of the Universities UK of the United Kingdom and of the Association of European Universities.

University of Warwick is one of the UK's leading universities, with an acknowledged reputation for excellence in research and teaching, for innovation, and for links with business and industry. Warwick has always taken the view that good research informs and strengthens the quality of education that it is able to offer its students. The original conception for the academic structure of the University was not to impose overall academic prescription but to make early appointments to the first professorships, selecting candidates with fresh and constructive ideas on how studies in their areas should be organised and developed.

The University of Edinburgh is an ancient university founded in 1583. Located in the heart of Edinburgh, it part of Scotland's vibrant capital city. Recently ranked 6th in the UK, it is consistently ranked as one of the top 50 Universities in the world. The university has 33,000 students, with almost a third of them being international students from over 140 countries. Famous alumnis of Edinbugh include, Charles Darwin (Naturalist), David Hume (Philosopher), Piers Sellers (NASA Astronaut), and writers Robert Louis Stevenson, Ian Rankin and J K Rowling.

Exeter is a top 10 UK university which combines world leading research with very high levels of student satisfaction. It is one of the UK’s most popular and successful universities with campuses in Exeter, Devon, and near Falmouth in Cornwall. The University also has a permanent office in Dubai. Students and staff enjoy some of the finest campus environments in the UK. The South West counties of Devon and Cornwall boast an unrivalled mix of city life, countryside and coastline.

Founded in 1451, the University of Glasgow is the fourth oldest university in the English-speaking world. We are one of the top 100 of the world's universities and have been named Scottish University of the Year by The Times and The Sunday Times Good University Guide 2018.

The University is taking a leading role in innovation and wealth creation in the South East of England. Successful partnership with industry has allowed the University as a whole to depend less upon Government grant sources than any other similar university in the UK. With a turnover of over £100 million, two-thirds of income is now earned through its own enterprise in association with industrial partners.

In the last national research review, 23 of our departments were rated nationally as being in the top ten in that subject area. This reinforced Leeds’ place in the UK's top ten universities for research. The University is also acclaimed worldwide for the quality of its teaching at undergraduate and postgraduate level. Leeds staff has won prestigious national awards for quality and innovation in teaching. Strong academic areas include the Arts, Business, Biological Sciences, Engineering, Earth and the Environment, Health including Medicine and Dentistry, Mathematics and Physical Sciences, Performing Arts and the Social Sciences. The University's International Foundation Year has seen students from over 65 countries successfully progress on to 106 different undergraduate degree programmes.

The University's International Foundation Year has seen students from over 65 countries successfully progress on to 106 different undergraduate degree programmes.

University: University of Leicester - School of Law
Description: The University of Leicester is a leading UK University committed to international excellence through the creation of world changing research and high quality, inspirational teaching. Leicester is the most socially inclusive of Britain's top-20 leading universities.

City University was founded in 1894 as the Northampton Institute and awarded full university status in 1966. It is based in the heart of London, close to the City of London, where it contributes significantly to the capital’s academic, cultural and business life. It has almost 11,500 students from 153 countries who benefit from the University’s internationally renowned experience of more than one hundred years’ of teaching and learning. City’s graduate employment record continues to be one of the best in the country. Dynamic research activity across all schools and institutes, including substantial interdisciplinary work, underpins City’s distinctive position as the University for business & the professions.

At the heart of our vision for internationalisation are two core values: cultural competency & having a global problem solving mindset. We define cultural competency as the ability to see the world through the lens of others – in all their diversity. This includes people from different nations and regions, socio-economic backgrounds, races, genders, ages, religions and abilities. Students and staff at King’s develop their cultural competency at home, abroad and online. Our own diversity, curriculum, interdisciplinarity, London location, dedication in service to society and global reach all combine to make this possible. We are committed to developing successful students, staff and alumni who can contribute to building a better, fairer world around them. The best minds with a clear sense of mission and world changing ideas come to King’s and are helped to develop and implement these ideas. We are an international community that serves the world.

At Queen Mary University of London, we believe that a diversity of ideas helps us achieve the previously unthinkable. Throughout our history, we’ve fostered social justice and improved lives through academic excellence. And we continue to live and breathe this spirit today, not because it’s simply ‘the right thing to do’ but for what it helps us achieve and the intellectual brilliance it delivers. Our reformer heritage informs our conviction that great ideas can and should come from anywhere. It’s an approach that has brought results across the globe, from the communities of east London to the favelas of Rio de Janeiro. We continue to embrace diversity of thought and opinion in everything we do, in the belief that when views collide, disciplines interact, and perspectives intersect, truly original thought takes form.

University: University College London, School of Management
Description: University College London (UCL) was founded in 1826 to bring higher education to those who were typically excluded from it. In 1878, it became the first university in England to admit women on equal terms as men. Located in the heart of London, UCL is a constituent college of the University of London and a member of the Russell Group, with approximately 850 professors and over 6,000 academic and research staff. UCL comprises 11 faculties: Arts and Humanities, Built Environment, Brain Sciences, Engineering, the Institute of Education, Laws, Life Sciences, Mathematical and Physical Sciences, Medical Sciences, Population Health Sciences, and Social and Historical Sciences.

University: University of London (The School of Oriental and African Studies)
Description: SOAS University of London is the only Higher Education institution in Europe specialising in the study of Asia, Africa and the Near and Middle East. SOAS is a remarkable institution. Uniquely combining language scholarship, disciplinary expertise and regional focus, it has the largest concentration in Europe of academic staff concerned with Africa, Asia and the Middle East. On the one hand, this means that SOAS scholars grapple with pressing issues - democracy, development, human rights, identity, legal systems, poverty, religion, social change - confronting two-thirds of humankind while at the same time remaining guardians of specialised knowledge in languages and periods and regions not available anywhere else in the UK. SOAS is synonymous with intellectual enquiry and achievement. As a global academic base and a crucial resource for London, SOAS is distinctively positioned to analyse, understand and explain some of the most challenging issues facing us in the world today. Our academic focus on the languages, cultures and societies of Africa, Asia and the Middle East makes us an indispensable interpreter in a complex world.

The University of Manchester has been created by bringing together The Victoria University of Manchester and UMIST, two of Britain's most distinguished universities, to create a powerful new force in British Higher Education. Manchester has a long tradition of excellence in Higher Education. UMIST can trace its roots back to 1824 and the formation of the Manchester Mechanics' Institute, whilst The Victoria University of Manchester was founded as Owens College in 1851. After 100 years of working together, these two great institutions are formally combining to form a single university, coming into being on 22 October 2004.

The University of Manchester has been created by bringing together The Victoria University of Manchester and UMIST, two of Britain's most distinguished universities, to create a powerful new force in British Higher Education. The University began as the Hartley Institute, which was founded in 1862. The University of Southampton was granted its Royal Charter in 1952, and has continued to grow and flourish ever since. Approximately 100 km from London Heathrow Airport

York Law School is an inspirational place for study and research. It is a top rated school for research, teaching and learning with a vibrant community committed to excellence. Their new, purpose-built school provides exceptional facilities and a dynamic environment for learning and research. They pride themselves on their innovative teaching and forward thinking approach that keeps them at the forefront of legal education. Their students are taught by some of the UK’s top legal scholars engaged in specialist research. They offer a program which is modern and relevant to the legal profession as well as the many other professions their students go on to join.

Evolved from the former Hong Kong College of Medicine which was instituted in 1887. In 1911, The University of Hong Kong was formally founded. From its modest beginnings of only two departments, the University has grown to embrace almost all major areas of teaching and research. It is one of the top Asia universities in the region. Today, the University of Hong Kong has a student population of over 15,000, including 9,415 undergraduates, 5,081 postgraduates and 1,024 international students. The University has an academic staff population of around 900.

One of the eight tertiary institutions funded by Hong Kong Special Administrative Region government through the University Grants Committee. The Faculty of Business at City University of Hong Kong offers undergraduate and postgraduate programmes tailormade to suit the specific needs of different professions, as well as research degrees leading to the awards of MPhil and PhD. The Faculty comprises 6 departments namely Accountancy, Economics and Finance, Information systems, Management, Management Sciences and marketing and is one of the largest business schools in Hong Kong. It has some 200 academic staff and eminent scholars recruited from around the world. This diversity ensures our participants have a global vision of the business environment.

University: Hong Kong University of Science and Technology
Description: The story of the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology begins with the late Sir Edward Youde, Governor of Hong Kong from 1982 to 1986, Sir S.Y. Chung, and others who foresaw the need in the territory for an educational institution to lead the way in the areas of science and technology vital to the region’s economic future. HKUST Business School comprises six departments: Accounting, Economics, Finance, Information & Systems Management, Management of Organizations, and Marketing. There have been eight congregations since the establishment of the business school in 1991. The University campus occupies a 60-hectares (150 acre) site of sweeping natural beauty on the Clear Water Bay peninsula in East Kowloon, less than 30 minutes, driving time from central Hong Kong.

In 1956, Hong Kong Baptist College was founded by the Baptist Convention of Hong Kong as a post-secondary college committed to the provision of whole person education. In 1983, Hong Kong Baptist College became a fullyfunded public tertiary institution. It gained university status in 1994 and was renamed Hong Kong Baptist University (HKBU). Today HKBU encompasses eight Faculties/Schools offering a range of undergraduate programmes, associate degree and higher diploma programmes as well as taught postgraduate programmes and research postgraduate programmes leading to the award of master and doctoral degrees.

The Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK) is a leading comprehensive research university. It has a total of 61 departments under the Faculties of Arts, Business Administration, Education, Engineering, Medicine, Science, Social Science and Law. Currently, it has approximately 21,000 students undertaking undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programmes.

University: China University of Political Science and Law
Description: China University of Political Science and Law is a national public research university specialized in law, arts, history, philosophy, economics, management and foreign languages established in 1952 in Beijing, China. China University of Political Science and Law is a first tier institution within the national key university Project 211 and the Project 985 Innovative Platforms for Key Disciplines as part of the national endeavor to build world-class universities. CUPL is widely considered to be one of the best Chinese universities in legal studies. It is also one of the most competitive and selective universities to enter in China.

Fudan consists of seventeen schools, and four independent departments (Physics, Chemistry, Macromolecular Science, and Environmental Science and Engineering). T he University confers bachelor's degrees in 68 academic disciplines, master's degrees in 209 disciplines and doctoral degrees in 175 academic disciplines. Years of learning and discovering have yielded great benefits as well as profits. In return, the multi-pattern development of the high-tech industries helps the University with breathtaking efficiency to industrialize the research outcomes. Meanwhile, a group of University-sponsored enterprises is emerging, filled with passion and ambition. Fudan has thus created its signature style of doing business.

Students of Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan nationality CANNOT apply to this university for ISEP. Jilin University (JLU) is a leading national university under the direct jurisdiction of China's Ministry of Education. Located in Changchun, the capital city of Jilin Province in Northeastern China, the University has eight campuses in five districts which are home to thirty-nine colleges covering eleven academic disciplines, including philosophy, economics, law, literature, education, history, science, engineering, agriculture, medicine, and management. The University boasts sixteen disciplinary areas, five national key laboratories, and eight national bases for the development of basic science. Other resources include five research bases for humanities and social sciences, seven key laboratories sponsored by the Ministry of Education and eleven by other ministries of Chinese government.

Founded in 1902, Nanjing University (NJU) is a century-old university and enjoys high reputation both in China and abroad. It is part of the prestigious C9 League of Universities in China. Presently, NJU has over 33,205 full time students, among whom are 14,188 undergraduate students, 15,667 master and doctoral students and 3,350 international students. It is a comprehensive university and offers courses ranging from humanities, business and engineering related disciplines. In terms of ranking, according to the Essential Science Indicators, 16 academic disciplines at NJU are ranked in the top 1% worldwide. NJU has three campuses: Xianlin Campus, Gulou Campus and Pukou Campus.

Students of Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan nationality CANNOT apply to this university for ISEP. Founded in 1919 by famous educationist Zhang Bo Ling and Yan Xiu in Tianjing city, Nankai University is not only one of top universities in China, but also a famous tertiary educational institute in the world. The university plays an active role in the international education exchange and research. The first Prime Minister of China Zhou En Lai graduated from Nankai University. The campus has a total area of 1.46 million square metres and it is only 137 km from Beijing. The university has 18 schools and currently, it has 28023 students.

Founded in 1898, Peking University was originally known as the Imperial University of Peking. It was the first national university covering comprehensive disciplines in China, and has been a leading institution of higher education in China since its establishment. In 1912, the university adopted its present name. At the end of the 20th century, the Chinese government put Peking University at the top of its agenda for promoting higher education, with the aim to build a world-class university in the 21st Century. Peking University has continually played the essential role of pioneers in the course of China's modernization. The university's traditional emphasis on patriotism, progress, democracy, and science, together with its educational standards of diligence, precision, factualism, and innovation, have been passed down from generation to generation.

Renmin University of China, or Renda, a public research university located in the Haidian District of Beijing, China. Founded by the Communist Party of China, RUC possesses academic strengths in humanities and social sciences, and is regarded highly among Chinese universities.

Founded in 1918, The School of Management, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, previously known as Railway Management Department is one of the earliest business schools in China. It originated from Nan Yang Business Institute which was founded by Mr. SHENG Xuanhuai with the permission of the government of Qing Dynasty in 1903. In 1996, Aetna International Inc. entered into cooperation with SJTU to develop the school of management. In 2000, the School of Management was officially named as Antai School of Management. In 2006, ASOM Officially renamed as Antai College of Economics and Management. Antai College of Economics and Management is located in Fa Hua campus, which is 15 minutes’ walk from the main campus.

University: Southwestern University of Finance and Economics (Research Institute of Economics and Management)
Description: Southwestern University of Finance and Economics (SWUFE) is a specialised finance, economics and business university located in Chengdu, China. SWUFE is one of the three specialised universities in finance and economics in China. As a training base for the development of the financial industry as well as the socio-economic development of western China, SWUFE is known as China’s financial talent pool. SMU students will have the opportunity to study at the Research Institute of Economics and Management (RIEM). RIEM was established in 2006 in dedication to high quality teaching and research in economics, finance and management.

University: Sun Yat Sen University, Business School
Description: Sun Yat-Sen University, previously named Guangdong University, was founded by Mr Sun Yat-Sen in 1924. He combined the National Normal University, Guangdong Law University and Guangdong Agricultural University to form Guangdong University. In 1926, Guangdong University was changed to Sun Yat-Sen University in memory of Mr Sun Yat-Sen. Located on the bank of the Zhujiang River and the cost of Southern Sea in the capital city of Guangdong Province - Guangzhou, Sun Yat-Sen University has a total area of 5.04 sq km. It is one of the key universities in China. Since its establishment, it has grown from the initial 7 schools into 19 schools in three campuses. It has a total student population of 40,400, among whom, 1970 PhDs, 5440 masters, 1250 post graduates and 17,100 undergraduates and 450 foreign students. It also has more major affiliated hospitals. It has been active in the academic exchange with foreign universities and academic institutions.

University: Sun Yat Sen University, School of Government
